alert.note: Alert for Northwest Pocahontas; Southeast Pocahontas; Southeast Randolph (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 01 at 6:16PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Randolph and northeastern Pocahontas Counties through 645 PM EDT... At 615 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Greenbank, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Cass Scenic Railroad, Greenbank, Snowshoe, Mingo, Durbin, Arbovale, Bartow, Boyer and Cheat Bridge. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
